Author: Watanabe
Title: Utility of Contrast-Enhanced Ultrasound for Early Therapeutic Evaluation of Hepatocellular Carcinoma After Transcatheter Arterial Chemoembolization
Reference_test: Contrast-enhanced US and CECT examinations were performed on the same day approximately 4 weeks after TACE to reevaluate the effectiveness. When negative enhancement was confirmed by both CEUS and CECT, both modalities were performed again on the same day approximately 16 weeks after TACE.
Diagnostic Cut-off:
When microbubbles were present nodularly within the tumor, the tumor was defined as showing positive enhancement. When no microbubble signal was present within the tumor, the tumor was defined
as showing negative enhancement.
TACE: miriplatin (Miripla; DainipponSumitomo Pharmaceutical, Tokyo, Japan) suspended in iodized oil (Ultra-Fluid; Dainippon-Sumitomo Pharmaceutical) was injected into the hepatic artery under balloon occlusion. Thereafter, 1-mm gelatin sponge particles (Gerpart; Nippon Kayaku, Tokyo, Japan) were injected to completely obstruct the tumor-feeding artery

Author: Takizawa
Title: Use of contrast-enhanced ultrasonography with a perflubutane-based contrast agent performed one day after transarterial chemoembolization for the early assessment of residual viable hepatocellular carcinoma
Index_test: contrast-enhanced US with a perflubutane-based contrast agent (Sonazoid) and a high mechanical index (MI) mode 24 hours after TACE
Reference_test: Digital subtraction angiography (DSA) and/or contrast-enhanced CT were performed 2–6 months after TACE and were used as the reference standard for residual HCC
TACE: TACE was performed by injecting a mixture ofiodized oil and miriplatin hydrate, followed by a gelatin sponge

Author: Shiozawa
Title: Predicting Therapeutic Efficacy of Transarterial Chemoembolization with Drug-Eluting Beads for Hepatocellular Carcinoma Using Contrast-Enhanced Ultrasound
Index_test: Enhancement patterns of vascular phase images on CEUS were compared before and within 3 days after DEB-TACE
Reference_test: The treatment response of DEB-TACE was evaluated using the Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (mRECIST) by CECT
Diagnostic Cut-off: Pattern A, no enhancement; Pattern B, peripheral ring enhancement; Pattern C, partial enhancement within or peripheral to tumors, and Pattern D, reduced or unchanged enhancement in the whole tumor.

Author: Wobser
Title: Evaluation of treatment response after chemoembolisation (TACE) in hepatocellular carcinoma using real time image fusion of contrast-enhanced ultrasound (CEUS) and computed tomography (CT) - Preliminary results
Index_test: Fusion of CEUS + CT Scan 24 hours after TACE
Diagnostic Cut-off: Reduction of tumor vascularization to less than 25% was regarded as “successful” treatment, whereas reduction to levels >25% was considered as “partial” treatment response.
